title: Francis Broccard (secretary to Pope Clement the Eighth) his alarm to all Protestant princes with a discovery of popish plots and conspiracies, after his co[n]version from popery to the Protestant religion / translated out of the Latin copy printed in Holland.
author: Brocardo, Francisco.
publisher: Printed by T.S. for William Rogers ...,
notes: Translation of: De foedere contra Protestantes.

The translator says in his preface, "The time when this discourse was written is manifest from the contents of it to be in the year 1603 ... The copy from whence I translated this, was printed at Amsterdam, by Jacob Younger, in the year 1677." Brocardo's work was appended to Francis Potter's "Interpretatio numeri 666", Amsterdam, 1677.
Reproduction of original in British Library.
